com.pump.animation

Interface AnimationReader

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ResettableAnimationReader
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GifReader

    public interface AnimationReader
    This is an iterator for an animation. Once a frame has been loaded, all previous frames should be discarded by this object.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int LOOP_FOREVER 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getDuration()
      This method will return -1 if the total duration of the animation is not yet known.
      int getFrameCount()
      If this can be determined, this returns the number of frames this reader will read.
      double getFrameDuration() 
      int getHeight() 
      int getLoopCount()
      Added primarily for GIF files, this returns the number of times an animation should loop.
      java.awt.image.BufferedImage getNextFrame(boolean cloneImage)
      This iterates through the file to the next frame image, or null if no more image data is available.
      int getWidth() 

    • Field Detail

      • LOOP_FOREVER

        static final int LOOP_FOREVER
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getNextFrame

        java.awt.image.BufferedImage getNextFrame(boolean cloneImage)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        This iterates through the file to the next frame image, or null if no more image data is available.
        Parameters:
        cloneImage - if this is true, this method will always return a new BufferedImage. If this is false, then this method may constantly return the same BufferedImage, updated for each frame.
        Returns:
        the next frame image, or null if there are no more frames.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a problem occurs reading the frame data

      • getDuration

        double getDuration()
        This method will return -1 if the total duration of the animation is not yet known. Otherwise it returns the duration (in seconds) if this animation.
        Returns:
        the total duration of this animation, or -1 if it is not yet known.

      • getFrameCount

        int getFrameCount()
        If this can be determined, this returns the number of frames this reader will read.

        Otherwise this returns -1. Note that since this pipes images through consecutively (without caching anything), this may return -1 more often than you'd like.

        Returns:
        the number of frames, or -1 if it is not yet known.

      • getLoopCount

        int getLoopCount()
        Added primarily for GIF files, this returns the number of times an animation should loop. If a file format, such as MOV, does not directly specify this value, it should be 1 (indicating that this animation should play exactly once). Note this may also return LOOP_FOREVER.

        This method may return -1 until this reader is completely finished, this indicates that this information is not yet known.

        Returns:
        the number loops, or LOOP_FOREVER, or -1 if it is not yet known.

      • getFrameDuration

        double getFrameDuration()
        Returns:
        the duration of the last frame provided by getNextFrame() in seconds. In rare cases this may be zero (indicating that a frame should be played as fast as possible, or maybe skipped), but it should never be negative.

      • getWidth

        int getWidth()
        Returns:
        the width of this image/animation, in pixels.

        This information needs to always be immediately available; it should not matter where in the iteration you are.

      • getHeight

        int getHeight()
        Returns:
        the height of this image/animation, in pixels.

        This information needs to always be immediately available; it should not matter where in the iteration you are.
